Message.Title: Beauty of my strategy...Jan 2014 $900 calls and Jan 2015 $1100 calls are both $75-
Message.Msg: Jan 2014 $900 calls have a giveaway of $970 while the Jan 2015 calls have a giveaway of $1175 At anytime one can TRADE or LEAP UP....But Jan 2015 ties up your money for 18 months?...Yes and no..you can trade in and out of options ..they are very liquid..notice, once the money is in your pocket, it stays there I showed this with AAPL $6000 then $700 calls only to LEAP DOWN down to $400...The trick is to capture the premium when it is high. Only a simple strategy to get people to ponder strategies

Topic.Title: Beauty of my strategy...Jan 2014 $900 calls and Jan 2015 $1100 calls are both $75-

Message.Msg: Bottom line? When you own a stock and have a strategy you have "wiggle room". Notice, I am always playing the 12 to 18 month COVERED CALLS ( you own the stock). Why?...That is where the real money is. On Thursday I will return with real numbers then on Friday will evaluate the suggestions, once again using closing numbers of the AUG and Jan 2014 and 2015 values. Remember, do NOT PLAY JULY OPTIONS...I have seen that movie before

Message.Title: Online Ad revenue
Message.Msg: Now that YAHOO has reported earnings,I have a question on online ad revenue. I never both to read the ads,it is either Etrade,Fidelity,some banks,phone companies or companies I have never heard of or products I never use. With this kind of economy where people are not even buying a coke,how long would the companies keep forking their hard earned money on online ads? As for google,with more people using their phones than desktop or laptop,do they really read Google or Yahoo or AOL or MSFT ads? comments please

Topic.Title: Online Ad revenue

Message.Msg: Google has much stronger online ad revenue than Yahoo for a variety of reason. People still search from smart phones, and Google works just fine from there. A close relative, who just retired and ran a small successful hedge fund based on fundamentals, not tricks or manipulations, picked AMZN and GOOG as the tech winners years ago, and as the years have gone by, she is being proven right, over and over again.

At present, it is recovering and should do quite nicely and has provided a double in less than a year for those who took advantage of the manipulation. People on that YMB more knowledgeable than me feel it will double or better within a year again n - BUT there is always volatility to relieve weak retail investors of their cash old.

Topic.Title: I only make suggestions and discuss ideas for thought

Message.Msg: I find the market VERY rational, in that the MMS always stick it to the retail investor. Take this upcoming earnings release. Does anyone want to bet me that the S/P will drop at least 50 points after the release REGARDLESS of earnings? MW will claim there was a "whisper" number out there. Garbage! It was the MMs shaking out the retail folks for a quick profit. Wanna bet that GOOG will be above 928 next week? That's why I'm selling put credit spreads VERY deep out-of-the-money. On Friday, I'll report back.
